00037 class JNIHelper
00038   {
00039   public:
00040     typedef void (*CallbackFunc)(JavaVM* jvm, void* closure);
00041 
00042     static VS_API_FERRY JNIHelper* getHelper();
00043 
00044     // Static convenience methods
00045     inline static JavaVM* sGetVM()
00046     {
00047       return getHelper()->getVM();
00048     }
00049     inline static void sSetVM(JavaVM *jvm)
00050     {
00051       getHelper()->setVM(jvm);
00052     }
00053     inline static jint sGetJNIVersion()
00054     {
00055       return getHelper()->getJNIVersion();
00056     }
00057     inline static JNIEnv *sGetEnv()
00058     {
00059       return getHelper()->getEnv();
00060     }
00061     inline static void *sGetPointer(jobject pointerRef)
00062     {
00063       return getHelper()->getPointer(pointerRef);
00064     }
00065     inline static void *sSetPointer(jobject pointerRef, void *newVal)
00066     {
00067       return getHelper()->setPointer(pointerRef, newVal);
00068     }
00069     inline static jobject sNewLocalRef(jobject ref)
00070     {
00071       return getHelper()->newLocalRef(ref);
00072     }
00073     inline static void sDeleteLocalRef(jobject ref)
00074     {
00075       return getHelper()->deleteLocalRef(ref);
00076     }
00077     inline static jobject sNewGlobalRef(jobject ref)
00078     {
00079       return getHelper()->newGlobalRef(ref);
00080     }
00081     inline static void sDeleteGlobalRef(jobject ref)
00082     {
00083       return getHelper()->deleteGlobalRef(ref);
00084     }
00085     inline static jweak sNewWeakGlobalRef(jobject ref)
00086     {
00087       return getHelper()->newWeakGlobalRef(ref);
00088     }
00089     inline static void sDeleteWeakGlobalRef(jweak ref)
00090     {
00091       return getHelper()->deleteWeakGlobalRef(ref);
00092     }
00093     inline static void sRegisterInitializationCallback(
00094         CallbackFunc func, void* closure)
00095     {
00096       return getHelper()->registerInitializationCallback(func, closure);
00097     }
00098     inline static void sRegisterTerminationCallback(
00099         CallbackFunc func, void* closure)
00100     {
00101       return getHelper()->registerTerminationCallback(func, closure);
00102     }
00103     // Actual methods
00104     VS_API_FERRY JavaVM* getVM();
00105     VS_API_FERRY void setVM(JavaVM* jvm);
00106 
00107     VS_API_FERRY void * getPointer(jobject pointerRef);
00108     VS_API_FERRY void * setPointer(jobject pointerRef, void *newVal);
00109 
00110     VS_API_FERRY jobject newLocalRef(jobject ref);
00111     VS_API_FERRY void deleteLocalRef(jobject ref);
00112     VS_API_FERRY jobject newGlobalRef(jobject ref);
00113     VS_API_FERRY void deleteGlobalRef(jobject ref);
00114     VS_API_FERRY jweak newWeakGlobalRef(jobject ref);
00115     VS_API_FERRY void deleteWeakGlobalRef(jweak ref);
00116 
00117     VS_API_FERRY jint getJNIVersion();
00118     VS_API_FERRY JNIEnv* getEnv();
00119 
00120     /*
00121      * Register a callback function to be called when the JNIHelper
00122      * gets a JavaVM context passed to it.  The JNIHelper will also
00123      * pass back to the callback the closure value registered with
00124      * the callback.
00125      *
00126      * NOTE: If the JNIHelper already has a JavaVM registered, it will
00127      * call the callback WHILE REGISTERING.  Be aware of this semantic
00128      * and deal accordingly.
00129      */
00130     VS_API_FERRY void registerInitializationCallback(CallbackFunc, void* closure);
00131     VS_API_FERRY void registerTerminationCallback(CallbackFunc, void*closure);
00132 
00133     VS_API_FERRY virtual ~JNIHelper();
00134 
00135     /*
00136      * This method is not meant for general calling.  A program that
00137      * is DAMN SURE it never needs to use the helper again can
00138      * call it, and we will delete memory.
00139      *
00140      * Really, the only use case for this is testing that our memory
00141      * clean-up code does work.
00142      */
00143     VS_API_FERRY static void shutdownHelper();
00144     /*
00145      * This needs to be public for the stupid auto_ptr to work,
00146      * but don't go creating one of these and expecting things to
00147      * work.
00148      */
00149     VS_API_FERRY JNIHelper();
00150 
00151     /*
00152      * Added for 2.1
00153      */
00154     
00155     VS_API_FERRY void throwOutOfMemoryError();
00156     
00157     VS_API_FERRY int32_t isInterrupted();
00158     
00159     VS_API_FERRY bool isInterruptedException(jthrowable exception);
00160     
00161     VS_API_FERRY void interrupt();
00162 
00163   private:
00164 
00165     JavaVM* mCachedVM;
00166     jint mVersion;
00167 
00168     jweak mJNIPointerReference_class;
00169     jmethodID mJNIPointerReference_setPointer_mid;
00170     jmethodID mJNIPointerReference_getPointer_mid;
00171     jthrowable mOutOfMemoryErrorSingleton;
00172 
00173     struct CallbackHelper {
00174       CallbackFunc mCallback;
00175       void* mClosure;
00176     };
00177     static void addCallback(std::list<CallbackHelper*>*, CallbackFunc, void*closure);
00178     static void processCallbacks(std::list<CallbackHelper*>*, JavaVM*, bool execFunc=true);
00179     std::list<CallbackHelper*> mInitializationCallbacks;
00180     std::list<CallbackHelper*> mTerminationCallbacks;
00181 
00182     void waitForDebugger(JNIEnv*);
00183 
00184     static JNIHelper* sSingleton;
00185     static volatile bool sDebuggerAttached;
00186 
00187     jweak mThread_class;
00188     jmethodID mThread_isInterrupted_mid;
00189     jmethodID mThread_currentThread_mid;
00190     jmethodID mThread_interrupt_mid;
00191 
00192     jweak mInterruptedException_class;
00193   };
